main event: Civilian and three or four others sighted three or four flying saucers over Concord, California on August 5, 1958.
interesting points: The sighting was reported to the Travis Air Force Base TCC (Tactical Control Center) by a civilian, who called 24 hours after the sighting.
The civilian made another report on August 15, 1958, which was considered an 'Operation Little TWIX'.
The sighting was reported as a CIRVIS (Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings) report, but it was noted that this was not a CIRVIS message.

The report was forwarded to the Commander of the Air Defense Command at Ent Air Force Base, the Commander of the Western Sea Frontier in San Francisco, and the Commanding General of the Continental Air Force.
The report concludes that there was 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation', and the 'Comments' section states that there was 'Insufficient Data'.
witnesses: civilian and three or four others
